intro: Stoebe nervigera, commonly known as narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, narrow leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows. It has a low-growing habit and produces a basal rosette of leaves, with flowering stems emerging from the center. Stoebe nervigera is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
